bug.short_desc: Selection Hotkeys Bug with Table/Multiple Interval and List/Additive

long_desc.thetext:
The following applies to tables with multiple interval selection mode, and to lists with additive selection mode.
With the latest stable Google Chrome selection hotkey Ctrl+A, and selection with arrows does not work at all neither in table, nor in the list.
With Firefox 3.0.12 selection behavior of Table differs from the one of List. Ctrl+A in List selects all items, no matter what the current selection is. Ctrl+A in Table inverts the current selection.

@Fabian, what is your experience from working with the table selections? Sounds resonable to align behavior of table and list.
Chris is on vacation right now, but we might assign him the bug depending on the proposed resolution.

Changing the behaviour of the table is very risky. It is one of the most used widgets and people may depend on this feature. The list is a little less risky so if we unify the bahaviour we should change the list.
Nontheless we have to fix the key event issue in Chrome.

extracted Chrome issue into a separate bug #2749.
Fabian, I pushed this issue about a unified selection behavior to 0.9. Agreed, or do you think it could rather easily be corrected now?
To me the list behavior is correct. I don't want to make it worse just because we can change the table. In the long term we will have a new table and the issue will be gone.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
